decks.notes: The main focus of this deck is to control the board through removal spells and creature threats, while ramping up mana to play powerful creatures like Wurmcoil Engine, Primeval Titan, and Garruk, Primal Hunter. The inclusion of Kessig Wolf Run allows for added reach and potential removal, while cards like Beast Within provide additional removal options. With a mix of ramp and control elements, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats and efficient removal spells.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game through a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and card advantage. The deck aims to stall the opponent's threats with cards like Doom Blade and Mana Leak, while generating advantage with cards like Snapcaster Mage and Forbidden Alchemy. The ability to recur threats like Wurmcoil Engine and Grave Titan with Unburial Rites and Sun Titan provides additional value. The deck also includes a mix of lifegain and protection spells to stabilize and outlast aggressive strategies.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly and aggressively deal damage to the opponent using a combination of low-cost creatures like Stormblood Berserker and Stromkirk Noble, along with burn spells like Incinerate and Brimstone Volley. The deck also includes cards like Shrine of Burning Rage to ramp up damage over time and finish off opponents. The inclusion of Chandra's Phoenix and Grim Lavamancer provides additional resilience and reach. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with fast, consistent damage output before they have a chance to stabilize.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through removal spells and counterspells, while also utilizing powerful creatures like Wurmcoil Engine and Sun Titan to maintain board presence. The deck also includes cards like Phantasmal Image and Unburial Rites to provide additional versatility and graveyard recursion. By carefully managing resources and answering threats efficiently, the deck aims to outlast opponents and secure victory through attrition. The mana base is designed to support a variety of colors to enable casting a wide range of spells efficiently.

The main idea of this control - Blade Control deck is to gain control of the game by using removal spells like Dismember and Oblivion Ring, while also developing a board presence with creatures like Blade Splicer and Consecrated Sphinx. The deck combines control elements with aggressive threats like Inkmoth Nexus and equipment like Batterskull and the Swords to apply pressure on the opponent. The inclusion of cards like Spellskite and Snapcaster Mage also provides versatility and options for different game situations, making the deck adaptable and resilient.

The primary focus of this Dimir Control deck is to maintain control over the game by utilizing a combination of removal spells, countermagic, and card advantage. With cards like Snapcaster Mage and Consecrated Sphinx, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent by efficiently dealing with threats while drawing extra cards. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Nihil Spellbomb and Liliana of the Veil helps disrupt opponent's strategies and resource management. Overall, this deck aims to control the pace of the game and come out ahead in the long run through attrition and card advantage.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by utilizing a combination of removal spells, card draw, and powerful creatures like Wurmcoil Engine and Sun Titan. The deck also includes powerful finishers such as Elesh Norn, Grand Cenobite and Consecrated Sphinx. By using cards like Snapcaster Mage and Unburial Rites, the deck can reuse powerful spells and creatures from the graveyard. The mana base is designed to ensure that the deck can consistently cast its spells across all three colors. Ultimately, the goal is to outvalue and outlast opponents through attrition and efficient resource management.

The main concept of this Esper Control deck is to have a combination of removal spells, counterspells, card draw and powerful creatures like Wurmcoil Engine and Sun Titan to control the game and outvalue the opponent. The deck also includes graveyard recursion through Unburial Rites to bring back powerful creatures from the graveyard. Liliana of the Veil serves as both removal and disruption, while the mana base provides a mix of colored sources for versatility. This deck excels at controlling the board and grinding out incremental advantages until it can establish a dominant position.

The main focus of this deck is to utilize Birthing Pod in combination with control elements to efficiently tutor for and play impactful creatures that also provide value upon entering or leaving the battlefield. The deck includes a variety of creatures with powerful abilities, as well as removal spells like Doom Blade to control the board. Additionally, cards like Phyrexian Rager and Viridian Emissary help generate card advantage and ramp up mana for quicker access to higher cost creatures. Ultimately, the strategy revolves around using Birthing Pod to create a flexible and adaptive game plan against opponents.

This deck focuses on utilizing a variety of threats to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. By playing efficient creatures like Blade Splicer and Mirran Crusader, backed up by counterspells and removal spells like Mana Leak and Dismember, it aims to keep the opponent's board clear while developing its own. The inclusion of powerful finishers like Hero of Bladehold and Sun Titan, along with equipment like Batterskull and the Swords, provide ways to close out the game once control has been established. The deck also utilizes lands like Inkmoth Nexus and Moorland Haunt for additional value.

This deck focuses on flooding the battlefield with tokens and buffing them to overwhelm the opponent quickly. Cards like Midnight Haunting and Shrine of Loyal Legions help generate tokens, while Intangible Virtue and Honor of the Pure boost their power. Elspeth Tirel and Hero of Bladehold provide additional token support, while cards like Timely Reinforcements and Day of Judgment help maintain board control. Gavony Township enhances the tokens further, making them even more potent in combat. The deck aims to quickly build a threatening board presence and put pressure on the opponent to finish the game swiftly.

This deck focuses on utilizing control spells to manage your opponent's threats while gradually building your own board presence. The inclusion of powerful planeswalkers like Garruk, Primal Hunter and Garruk Relentless allows for both card advantage and creature generation. Removal spells like Galvanic Blast and Arc Trail help deal with threats efficiently, while creatures like Thrun, the Last Troll and Consecrated Sphinx provide strong win conditions. With a mix of creatures, spells, and lands that support each other, this deck aims to control the game until you can overwhelm your opponent.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells, removal, and card advantage. It aims to stall the game until it can play its powerful finishers like Sun Titan and Wurmcoil Engine. The deck also has a reanimation sub-theme with Unburial Rites to bring back key creatures from the graveyard. The planeswalkers Jace, Memory Adept and Liliana of the Veil provide additional card advantage and disruption. Overall, the deck aims to outlast and outvalue the opponent through strategic play and resource management.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by using various removal spells and counters, while also utilizing powerful creatures like Wurmcoil Engine, Consecrated Sphinx, and Sun Titan to dominate the battlefield. The deck also includes cards like Snapcaster Mage and Unburial Rites for flexibility and recursion. It aims to outvalue the opponent through card advantage and efficient removal, while also having the ability to stabilize with cards like Day of Judgment and Timely Reinforcements. Liliana of the Veil serves as a versatile Planeswalker to disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The main concept of this Esper Control deck is to control the game through counterspells, removal, and card advantage, while using graveyard recursion to bring back powerful threats like Wurmcoil Engine and Grave Titan. The deck focuses on staying alive early on with cards like Doom Blade and Mana Leak, before transitioning into the mid to late game where Sun Titan and Unburial Rites provide additional threats and value. The deck also includes versatile cards like Snapcaster Mage and Forbidden Alchemy for flexibility in various situations.

The main focus of this UW Control deck is to control the game by countering opponent's spells, removing threats, and drawing cards to outvalue the opponent. With a mix of counterspells, removal, and card draw, it aims to stabilize the board and win by playing powerful threats like Wurmcoil Engine and Consecrated Sphinx. The deck also has a good mix of creatures, planeswalkers, and noncreature spells to deal with a variety of threats, making it versatile and adaptable in different matchups.
